channel.title: Ammar M. Plumber
channel.description: Recent content in Neuroscience on Ammar M. Plumber

item.title: Dopamine and impulsivity — more is less or more is more?
item.description: The article examines impulsivity and its connection to striatal dopamine function, indicating an inverted U-shaped relationship with treatment implications for impulse-control disorders.

item.title: Progress in Neuroeducation — Mackey 2019
item.description: A survey of neuroscience research on education evaluation for students with learning disabilities. The talk covers normalization, compensation, and the influence of curiosity on educational outcomes.

item.title: Rewarding reading in school
item.description: Examining how rewards can undermine intrinsic motivation to do things.

item.title: Selective Perception in Infants — Saxe 2020
item.description: Rebecca Saxe's research shows that babies are not passive learners but actively exhibit preferences for social and informative stimuli from an early age.

item.title: The Phainomena in Aristotle's De Anima
item.description: Aristotle's philosophy of science in his treatise on the soul.

item.title: Neural unresponsiveness to fairness in MDD patients — state or trait?
item.description: A research proposal drafted by me and two other classmates for a graduate course in neuroeconomics taught by Joseph Kable at UPenn.
